name: Pasta with Bacon and Tomato Sauce
instructions: Cut the onion, red peppers and bacon into small pieces.
Heat some olive oil in a pan and fry the onion, red peppers and bacon.
Add oregano, garlic, tomatoes and water and cook for 20 minutes.
Cook the pasta in a big pot of boiling water.
Serve the pasta with the sauce, and enjoy!

name: Chicken Curry
instructions: Dice the chicken breast and onion.
Crush the garlic and grate the ginger.
Fry the onion, garlic, and ginger until golden.
Add the chicken and curry powder and cook until browned.
Pour in the coconut milk and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with cilantro before serving.

name: Beef Stew
instructions: Cut beef into cubes.
Chop carrots and onions, and peel potatoes.
Brown the beef cubes in a pot.
Add all vegetables and cook for a few minutes.
Add beef broth, tomato paste, and thyme.
Simmer on low heat for 2 hours.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: Chop all vegetables and tofu.
Heat sesame oil in a large pan.
Add vegetables and tofu and stir fry for 10 minutes.
Drizzle soy sauce and sprinkle chili flakes.
Stir fry for another 5 minutes and serve hot.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
In a pan, cook pancetta or bacon until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and Parmesan cheese together.
Drain spaghetti, then quickly toss in the egg mixture until coated.
Add pancetta or bacon mixture, season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: 500g mixed mushrooms (such as button, shiitake, and cremini), sliced
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan. Sauté onions until translucent, then add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add Arborio rice and stir until coated in oil and slightly translucent.
If using, pour in white wine and cook until evaporated.
Gradually add vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently until absorbed before adding more.
In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms until golden brown.
Once rice is cooked and creamy, stir in grated Parmesan cheese, sautéed mushrooms, and fresh thyme. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Grilled Lemon Herb Salmon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Rub salmon fillets with olive oil, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and dill. Season with salt and pepper.
Place lemon slices on top of each salmon fillet.
Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through and grill marks appear.
Serve hot, garnished with additional herbs and lemon slices.

name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into thick slices.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving plate.
Tear fresh basil leaves and sprinkle them over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle balsamic vinegar and extra virgin olive oil over the salad.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.

name: Teriyaki Chicken
ingredients: Sesame seeds and sliced green onions for garnish
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and simmer until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken pieces.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
Serve hot with rice or vegetables.

name: Greek Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine diced tomatoes, diced cucumber, sliced red onion, and pitted Kalamata olives.
Add crumbled feta cheese to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients in the large bowl.
Toss gently until everything is evenly coated with the dressing.
Serve immediately as a refreshing and flavorful salad, or chill in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa, guacamole
instructions: In a skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is softened.
Add chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
Warm tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave.
Assemble tacos by spooning beef mixture onto each tortilla and adding desired toppings.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Homemade Pizza
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to the highest temperature (usually around 500°F or 260°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to desired thickness.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Arrange pepperoni slices, bell peppers, red onion, and fresh basil leaves on top of the cheese.
Drizzle olive oil over the toppings and season with salt and black pepper.
Bake pizza in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is bubbly.
Slice and serve hot.
